review_title: VFMC's evolution is a disappointment and heartbreak
pros: Working with the patients and facilitating groups is very fulfilling. Being a part of the process with patients as they overcome hurdles and grow through their hardest moments is a privilege.
cons: Corporate brought so many changes over the year that it's unrecognizable. Ethics was a common concern that arose and the staff and patients suffered a lot because of corporate decisions. Morale was destroyed and corporate lost the trust of staff who went through the changes with them. Massive turnover in staffing throughout the year didn't seem to really stabilize. We were always understaffed and hospital census was constantly increasing for profits. The services we provided to patients were an embarrassment. So long as there was payout from insurance (which is overwhelming medicaid patients), corporate didn't care about quality of care.

review_title: Mom and Pop style rehab center
pros: Very diverse staff, friendly staff and co-worker relationships, flexible, provides quality care to patients struggling with addiction, numerous programs for recovery. Overall good work culture. Embracing all cultural and ethnic backgrounds. Easily gain weight from the food being shared.
cons: On very old grounds and the building is dated, although it has character. Limited space for career growth. Some issues with communication between and at times even within departments. Your hard work can go unnoticed, but mistakes are highlighted.
